PageTitle: peer discard-ext-community(BGP multi-instance VPN instance IPv4 address family view)(IPv4)
FuncDef:
The peer discard-ext-community command configures a BGP device to discard the extended community attributes carried by routes received from a specified peer.
The undo peer discard-ext-community command cancels the configuration. The peer discard-ext-community command configures a BGP device to discard the extended community attributes carried by routes received from a specified peer. The undo peer discard-ext-community command cancels the configuration. By default, the extended community attributes in the routing information of peers are not discarded.
ParentView: BGP multi-instance VPN instance IPv4 address family view

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the IPv4 address of a peer.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

ExtraInfo: If a peer only needs to accepts routes but not extended community attributes, you can run this command on the peer to discard the extended community attributes from the received routes.
